intro: Shuteria involucrata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
